verses.verse: O Israel <WH3478>, return <WH7725> unto Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430>; for thou hast fallen <WH3782> by thine iniquity <WH5771>.

Take <WH3947> with you words <WH1697>, and return <WH7725> unto Jehovah <WH3068>: say <WH559> unto him <WH5375>, Take away all iniquity <WH5771>, and accept <WH3947> that which is good <WH2896>: so will we render <WH7999> as bullocks <WH6499> the offering of our lips <WH8193>.

Assyria <WH804> shall not save <WH3467> us <WH7392>; we will not ride upon horses <WH5483>; neither will we say <WH559> any more to the work <WH4639> of our hands <WH3027>, Ye are our gods <WH430>; for in thee the fatherless <WH3490> findeth mercy <WH7355>.
I will heal <WH7495> their backsliding <WH4878>, I will love <WH157> them freely <WH5071>; for mine anger <WH639> is turned away from him <WH7725>.
I will be as the dew <WH2919> unto Israel <WH3478>; he shall blossom <WH6524> as the lily <WH7799>, and cast forth <WH5221> his roots <WH8328> as Lebanon <WH3844>.
His branches <WH3127> shall spread <WH3212>, and his beauty <WH1935> shall be as the olive-tree <WH2132>, and his smell <WH7381> as Lebanon <WH3844>.

They that dwell <WH3427> under his shadow <WH6738> shall return <WH7725>; they shall revive <WH2421> as the grain <WH1715>, and blossom <WH6524> as the vine <WH1612>: the scent <WH2143> thereof shall be as the wine <WH3196> of Lebanon <WH3844>.

Ephraim <WH669> shall say <WH6091>, What have I to do any more with idols? I have answered <WH6030>, and will regard <WH7789> him <WH7488>: I am like a green fir-tree <WH1265>; from me is thy fruit <WH6529> found <WH4672>.

Who is wise <WH2450>, that he may understand <WH995> these things <WH995>? prudent, that he may know <WH3045> them <WH1870>? for the ways of Jehovah <WH3068> are right <WH3477>, and the just <WH6662> shall walk <WH3212> in them <WH6586>; but transgressors shall fall therein <WH3782>.
